A film producer and third husband of Judy Garland, known for producing her movies and stage shows, including the iconic "A Star is Born" (1954).

Written by: Emily Carter

Sidney Luft: The Man Behind Judy Garland's Comeback

Sidney Luft, a show business figure, is best known for being the third husband of actress and singer Judy Garland, as well as her manager and producer. He played a crucial role in reviving her career, producing the 1954 musical remake of A Star Is Born, which although failed to recoup its production costs, was a major critical success.

Early Life and Career

Born on November 2, 1915, in New York City, Luft grew up in Westchester County, the son of Jewish immigrants from Russia and Germany. Before entering the entertainment industry, Luft was an amateur boxer and barroom brawler, earning the nickname "One-Punch Luft." He also served as a pilot in the Royal Canadian Air Force and later became a test pilot for Douglas Aircraft Company.

From Secretary to Producer

Luft's first assignment in Hollywood was as the secretary and manager of dancer Eleanor Powell. His experience in the entertainment industry eventually led him to become the manager and producer of Judy Garland, whom he married in 1952. Under his guidance, Garland's career began to flourish, with Luft securing a deal with Warner Bros. to bankroll her comeback film, A Star Is Born.

Personal Life and Marriages

Luft was married five times throughout his life. His first marriage was to aspiring actress MaryLou Simpson in 1940, which ended in divorce in 1942. He then married actress Lynn Bari in 1943, with whom he had two children, a daughter who died shortly after birth and a son named John Michael Luft born in 1948. The couple divorced in 1950. Luft's most notable marriage was to Judy Garland, with whom he had two children, Lorna Luft born in 1952 and Joseph Wiley Joey Luft born in 1955.

Legacy and Impact

Although Luft's personal life was marred by controversies, including accusations of drunkenness, gambling, and abuse, his contribution to Judy Garland's career cannot be overlooked. He played a crucial role in reviving her career and producing A Star Is Born, which remains a classic to this day. Luft's legacy serves as a testament to the power of perseverance and dedication in the entertainment industry.

FAQ

What was Sidney Lufts role in the life and career of Judy Garland?

How did Sidney Luft contribute to Judy Garlands film career?

Sidney Luft was instrumental in helping Judy Garland secure film roles and negotiating her contracts. He was a key figure in her professional life, helping her to navigate the complexities of the film industry.

What were some of Sidney Lufts own accomplishments?

Sidney Luft was a successful film producer and manager in his own right. He produced several films and television shows, including A Star is Born and I Could Go On Singing.

How did Sidney Lufts relationship with Judy Garland affect his own life?

Sidney Lufts relationship with Judy Garland was intense and all-consuming. He devoted himself to her career and well-being, often putting his own needs and desires second.

Sidney Lufts legacy in the entertainment industry is one of dedication and loyalty. He is remembered as a key figure in Judy Garlands life and career, and as a talented producer and manager in his own right.
